thread.title: Clinton’s Tyler Thackerson and DeMarea Whitt sweep honors - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Clinton’s Tyler Thackerson and DeMarea Whitt sweep honors - PrepXtra Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Clinton’s Tyler Thackerson and DeMarea Whitt sweep honors - PrepXtra
text:
Clinton High School's Tyler Thackerson and DeMarea Whitt helped the Dragons snap a three-game losing streak in a hurry last Friday. On Thursday, the teammates swept the pros' picks for PrepXtra offensive and defensive players of the week.
Thackerson, a senior quarterback, completed 22 of 29 passes for 391 yards and a school-record six touchdowns in a 49-14 win over Lenoir City. Whitt, a junior wide receiver/defensive back, intercepted two passes, but also caught seven passes for 130 yards and three TDs.
Both players were online winners. Thackerson accrued 1,755 of 2,883 votes (60.87 percent) to win on offense. Maryville quarterback Dylan Hopkins, who accounted for 270 total yards and three touchdowns, was second with 695.
Fulton's Kentel Williams was third with 338. The senior wide receiver/defensive back accumulated 218 all-purpose yards and scored touchdowns on a 49-yard reception, 82-yard run and 28-yard interception return in a 71-14 win over Carter. Morristown West senior running back DeAndre Delaney, who rushed for 262 yards and three TDs, was fourth with 95 votes.
Whitt was the defensive winner with 1,692 of 3,966 votes (42.7 percent).
West junior defensive back Simeon Hester had 1,403 votes. He made the most of his first start, intercepting two passes, returning one 60 yards for a TD.
Halls junior linebacker Caden Harbin (540 votes) was next after posting 18 tackles, including five for loss and three sacks, blocking a punt and forcing a fumble. Alcoa senior linebacker Garrett Livesay was fourth with 331 votes after posting 13 tackles.
A new batch of nominees will be posted online at PrepXtra.com on Saturday. The pros picks will be honored during PrepXtra's football banquet at the end of the season. Coaches can nominate candidates on Friday night by email at sports@knoxnews.com or by calling 865-342-6291.
